thread.title: Chelsea boss Antonio Conte targeting five summer signings
thread.title_full: Chelsea boss Antonio Conte targeting five summer signings | Daily Mail Online

author: Matt Barlow for the Daily Mail
title: Chelsea boss Antonio Conte targeting five summer signings
text:
Virgil van Dijk, Alvaro Morata and Moussa Dembele will top Chelsea's list of transfer targets at the end of the season.
The winter window closed without a new arrival at Stamford Bridge, a rare phenomenon in modern times and a sign of confidence as they pursue the Premier League title.
Antonio Conte made it clear he was not prepared to make signings for the sake of it and clutter his squad with players who may not be precisely what he wanted.
Chelsea boss Antonio Conte is targeting at least five signings in the summer
Chelsea believe that they are well set to lure defender Virgil van Dijk from Southampton
Instead it has been a month of tailoring with Oscar, John Obi Mikel and Branislav Ivanovic sold, the squad trimmed and space created in anticipation of an active summer market.
Van Dijk has been identified as a key defensive target and Chelsea believe they are well set to lure him from Southampton when the season ends.
In the meantime, Conte will take a closer look at Kurt Zouma, Nathan Ake, recalled from Bournemouth, and Andreas Christensen, into the last four months of a two-year loan at Borussia Monchengladbach.
There is lots of interest in Zouma, Ake and Christensen. The young trio of defenders will command big fees if the Chelsea boss decides he can do without any of them.
Bournemouth bid Â£18million for Ake last month and Southampton have an eye on him as a potential replacement if and when they lose Van Dijk.
Up front, where the future of Diego Costa again unclear, Conte will return to test Real Madrid on their willingness to sell Morata having failed to land him last summer.
The Blues will also continue their pursuit of Celtic forward Moussa Dembele
With Michy Batshuayi yet to convince, Chelsea will also continue their pursuit of Dembele from Celtic.
Asmir Begovic, who almost joined Bournemouth last month, can be expected to leave and be replaced.
John Terry, out of contract again in June, is unlikely to extend his playing career at the Bridge and Cesc Fabregas is not integral to Conte's plans, although reluctant to leave.
Conte will return to test Real Madrid's willingness to sell Alvaro Morata
Conte wants at least five new recruits, adding cover and competition at wing-back and in central midfield, especially as he appears certain to be back in Europe.
Chelsea have made the mistake of resting on laurels in the past having won the title. It happened under Carlo Ancelotti in 2010 and under Jose Mourinho in 2015.
It will create for Conte a squad of his own making.
